{{cpp/title|get_time}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=iomanip|since=c++11|
template&lt; class CharT &gt;
/*unspecified*/ get_time( std::tm* tmb, const CharT* fmt );
}}

When used in an expression {{c|in &gt;&gt; get_time(tmb, fmt)}}, parses the character input as a date/time value according to format string {{c|fmt}} according to the {{lc|std::time_get}} facet of the locale currently imbued in the input stream {{c|in}}. The resultant value is stored in a {{lc|std::tm}} object pointed to by {{c|tmb}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|tmb|valid pointer to the {{lc|std::tm}} object where the result will be stored}}
{{par|fmt|pointer to a null-terminated {{tt|CharT}} string specifying the conversion format
{{cpp/locale/time_get/time_get format}}
}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{cpp/io/manip/iomanip return value|get_time}}

===Notes===
As specified in {{lc|std::time_get::do_get}}, which this function calls, it's unspecified if this function zero out the fields in {{c|*tmb}} that are not set directly by the conversion specifiers that appear in {{c|fmt}}: portable programs should initialize every field of {{c|*tmb}} to zero before calling {{tt|std::get_time}}.

===Example===
{{example
|1=Note: choose clang or gcc &gt;= 12.1 to observe the output. libstdc++ before 12.1 does not correctly implement the {{c|%b}} specifier: [https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=78714 bug #78714].
|code=
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::tm t = {};
    std::istringstream ss("2011-Februar-18 23:12:34");
    ss.imbue(std::locale("de_DE.utf-8"));
    ss &gt;&gt; std::get_time(&amp;t, "%Y-%b-%d %H:%M:%S");
    
    if (ss.fail())
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "Parse failed\n";
    else
        std::cout &lt;&lt; std::put_time(&amp;t, "%c") &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
Sun Feb 18 23:12:34 2011
}}
